tn.text: On the first day of the week, women come early because they expect to use spices to anoint Jesus' body. They are surprised to see a young man who tells them Jesus is alive, but they are afraid and do not tell anyone.

tn.ref: When the Sabbath day was over
tn.text: That is, when the sun had set on the seventh day and the first day of the week had begun.

tn.ref: the stone had been rolled away
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone had rolled away the stone" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

The angel is emphatically stating that Jesus has risen from the dead. This can be translated in active form. AT: "He arose!" or "God raised him from the dead!" or "He raised himself from the dead!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Jesus appears first to Mary Magdalene, who tells the disciples, then he appears to two others as they walk in the country, and later he appears to the eleven disciples.

tn.ref: on the first day of the week
tn.text: "on Sunday"
"They heard Mary Magdalene say"

tn.ref: he appeared in a different form
tn.text: Jesus was the person whom the "two of them" saw, but what they saw did not look like Jesus, so they did not know they were looking at Jesus.
two of "those who were with him" ([[:en:bible:notes:mrk:16:09|16:10]])
The rest of the disciples did not believe what the two who had been walking in the country said.
When Jesus meets with the eleven, he rebukes them for their unbelief and tells them to go out into all the world to preach the gospel.
These are the eleven disciples who remained after Judas left them.

tn.ref: they were reclining at the table
tn.text: This is a metonym for eating, which was the usual way people in that day ate meals. AT: "they were eating a meal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
They were lying down on the left side, using their right hand to eat the food on the table.

Jesus is rebuking his disciples because they would not believe in him. Translate this idiom so it is understood that the disciples were not believing Jesus. AT: "refusal to believe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here "the world" is a metonym for the people in the world. AT: "Go everywhere there are people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

This is a hyperbole, an exaggeration, and a metonym for the people in "all the world." AT: "absolutely everybody" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: He who believes and is baptized will be saved
tn.text: The word "He" refers to anyone. This sentence can be made active. AT: "God will save all people who believe and allow you to baptize them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he who does not believe will be condemned
tn.text: The word "he" refers to anyone. This clause can be made active. AT: "God will condemn all people who do not believe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: These signs will go with those who believe
tn.text: Mark speaks of miracles as though they were people going along with the believers. AT: "People watching those who believe will see these things happen and know that I am with the believers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
Possible meanings are 1) Jesus is giving a general list: "In my name they will do things like these: They" or 2) Jesus is giving an exact list: "These are the things they will do in my name: They."

Here "name" is associated with Jesus' authority and power. AT: "By the authority of my name" or "By the power of my name." See how "in your name" is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:mrk:09:38|9:38]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: he was taken up into heaven and sat
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God took him up into heaven, and he sat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: at the right hand of God
tn.text: "where the one to whom God gives the most honor and power sits"
"showed that his words, which they were speaking, were true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
